definition: paper/hard copy/printed (as opposed to electronically displayed)
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: The extra edition is a kind of the valuable paper media.
sentences.chinese: 號外是一種頗有價值的紙質傳媒。

sentences.english: Yes, that’s right. The good ‘ol book, in paper form, is still one of the greatest gifts there is.
sentences.chinese: 是的，一本紙質的好書仍是其中一個非常重要的禮物。

sentences.english: Today, Amazon sells more e-books than paperbacks.
sentences.chinese: 今天，亞馬遜賣出的電子書比紙質書可要多。

sentences.english: The emergency of online media has rapidly grabbed the survival space of article-based media.
sentences.chinese: 網絡媒體出現後迅速搶佔了紙質媒體的生存空間。

sentences.english: Do not use string or paper over-wrap.
sentences.chinese: 不要使用繩子或紙質外包裝。

sentences.english: In Hong Kong this week, protesters are burning cardboard cutouts of iPhones.
sentences.chinese: 本週，已有抗議者在香港焚燒紙質iPhone面板。

sentences.english: Readers of all ages retain a remarkable emotional attachment to the thing.
sentences.chinese: 各個年齡段的讀者難以割捨對紙質圖書的這份依戀。

sentences.english: The Seattle Post-Intelligencer printed its final edition yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 《西雅圖郵報》於昨日發行最後一期紙質報。

sentences.english: So in a traditional mailroom, again the paper comes in, letters come in on mail.
sentences.chinese: 所以在傳統的收發室作業中，有紙質的文件，有信件。

sentences.english: Why did you get a paper check and not wire?
sentences.chinese: 你爲什麼選用紙質支票，而不用電匯。

sentences.english: The fourth chapter focuses on the collection of votes, and the integration of paper-based books.
sentences.chinese: 第四章着重論述藏書票與紙質書籍的一體化。

sentences.english: Beijing's metro will only sell electronic tickets starting from Monday, marking the end to an era of paper tickets.
sentences.chinese: 北京地鐵今日起停售紙質票，全部啓用電子車票。

sentences.english: In the system, the papery archive is transferred into digital document image.
sentences.chinese: 在系統中，擬定將紙質檔案數字化爲數字圖像。

sentences.english: In short, physical books can't compete with other print media for advertisers.
sentences.chinese: 簡而言之，紙質書不能同其他平面媒體競爭廣告客戶。

sentences.english: Pick up a real book, sit down and start to read.
sentences.chinese: 拿起紙質書，坐下來好好看。

sentences.english: This is the beginning of the end of paper.
sentences.chinese: 這只是紙質媒介結束後的開端。

definition: entity/substance/thing that has a material existence (as opposed to a conceptual, virtual or online existence)/the real thing (as opposed to an image or model of it)
books (in a library or bookstore)/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]
simplified form of Chinese characters, as opposed to traditional form 繁體|繁体[fan2 ti3]
simplified Chinese character, as opposed to traditional Chinese character 繁體字|繁体字[fan2 ti3 zi4]
